channel.title: I want to know a couple of things
channel.description: Hey peeps this is Mupescape :D, anyway I just wanted to know 1- Is there anyway I can make it say this for a spell when you don't got the runes for the Ice barrage and High alchemy [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/Notenoughrunes.jpg[/img] 2- I wanted to know because this is wierd I use one version of my server 'Mupescape v2' (the only with silab capes) and another version (without silabcapes) and I use my client the silabcapes on shows this when I log in on it Silabsoft server: [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/notworking.jpg[/img] Non-Silabsoft server: [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/working.jpg[/img](this pic is from RicScape v2) 3-I wanted to know how can I change the color of the stats from white and blue to white and red [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/stats.jpg[/img](pic from ricscape v2 also) If anyone knows any kind of answers to these please tell me thanks :D --Mupescape

item.title: I want to know a couple of things
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

ok dude, here… put it after this

if((castSpell == 6003) && castOnItem == 1127) { // lvl 6 enchant lol on rune plate deleteItem(castOnItem, castOnSlot, 1); addItem(3481, 1); addSkillXP((31*playerLevel[6]), 6); startAnimation(712); playerGfx(186, 1); newAnimDelay = 6; newAnim = 712; newAnimRequired = true; }

REMEMBER THIS IS THE CODE!

else if(castSpell == 1178) //High Alch fixed by Darque Star { if(playerLevel[6] >= 55) { if((playerHasItemAmount(561, 10) == false) || (playerHasItemAmount(554, 5) == false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(561, 10) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(554, 5) == true)) { alchvaluez = (alchvaluez / 3); deleteItem(castOnItem, castOnSlot, 1); addItem(995, alchvaluez); addSkillXP((115*playerLevel[6]), 6); startAnimation(712); playerGfx(113, 0); newAnimDelay = 6; newAnim = 712; newAnimRequired = true; deleteItem(561,getItemSlot(561), 10); deleteItem(554,getItemSlot(554), 5); } } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 55) { sendMessage("You need at least 55 Magic to cast High Level Alchemy"); } }

the reason it has to be under a

if(
, because its an else code. you know what i mean? try it out.

Read full topic

item.title: I want to know a couple of things
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

ok then right after the

println_debug("castOnSlot: "+castOnSlot+" castOnItem: "+castOnItem+" e3: "+e3+" castSpell: "+castSpell);} int alchvaluez = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(castOnItem, 0, castOnSlot));
press enter and put this in [code]else if(castSpell == 1178) //High Alch fixed by Darque Star { if(playerLevel[6] >= 55) { if((playerHasItemAmount(561, 10) == false) || (playerHasItemAmount(554, 5) == false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(561, 10) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(554, 5) == true)) { alchvaluez = (alchvaluez / 3); deleteItem(castOnItem, castOnSlot, 1); addItem(995, alchvaluez); addSkillXP((115*playerLevel[6]), 6); startAnimation(712); playerGfx(113, 0); newAnimDelay = 6; newAnim = 712; newAnimRequired = true; deleteItem(561,getItemSlot(561), 10); deleteItem(554,getItemSlot(554), 5); } } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 55) { sendMessage("You need at least 55 Magic to cast High Level Alchemy"); } }[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: I want to know a couple of things

item.title: I want to know a couple of things
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

Mine don’t say

sidebarchanging = true;

it says

[code]case 237: //Magic on Items
int castOnSlot = inStream.readSignedWord();
int castOnItem = inStream.readSignedWordA();
int e3 = inStream.readSignedWord();
int castSpell = inStream.readSignedWordA();
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin”)){
println_debug("castOnSlot: “+castOnSlot+” castOnItem: “+castOnItem+” e3: “+e3+” castSpell: "+castSpell);}
int alchvaluez = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(castOnItem, 0, castOnSlot));

if((castSpell == 6003) && castOnItem == 1127) { // lvl 6 enchant lol on rune plate
deleteItem(castOnItem, castOnSlot, 1);
addItem(3481, 1);
addSkillXP((31*playerLevel[6]), 6);
startAnimation(712);
playerGfx(186, 1);
newAnimDelay = 6;
newAnim = 712;
newAnimRequired = true;
}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: I want to know a couple of things

item.title: I want to know a couple of things
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

ok, i see your question now you dont need the teleport.cfg! this answers ur question…find (CTRL+F) case 237 and you should see something like this [code]case 237: //Magic on Items
int castOnSlot = inStream.readSignedWord();
int castOnItem = inStream.readSignedWordA();
int e3 = inStream.readSignedWord();
int castSpell = inStream.readSignedWordA();
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“ilooti”)){
println_debug("castOnSlot: “+castOnSlot+” castOnItem: “+castOnItem+” e3: “+e3+” castSpell: "+castSpell);}
int alchvaluez = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(castOnItem, 0, castOnSlot));

sidebarChangeTimer = 2;
sidebarChange = 6;
sidebarChanging = true;[/code]

now at the end of the

sidebarchanging = true;
press enter and add this!

else if(castSpell == 1178) //High Alch fixed by Darque Star { if(playerLevel[6] >= 55) { if((playerHasItemAmount(561, 10) == false) || (playerHasItemAmount(554, 5) == false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(561, 10) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(554, 5) == true)) { alchvaluez = (alchvaluez / 3); deleteItem(castOnItem, castOnSlot, 1); addItem(995, alchvaluez); addSkillXP((115*playerLevel[6]), 6); startAnimation(712); playerGfx(113, 0); newAnimDelay = 6; newAnim = 712; newAnimRequired = true; deleteItem(561,getItemSlot(561), 10); deleteItem(554,getItemSlot(554), 5); } } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 55) { sendMessage("You need at least 55 Magic to cast High Level Alchemy"); } }

ENJOY! :D[br][size=1]Posted on: November 04, 2007, 10:38:12 AM[/size][hr]did that help you out?

Read full topic

item.title: I want to know a couple of things
item.dc:creator: @Danny068 Danny068
item.description:
@Danny068 wrote:

FOR NO RUNES NEEDED

Open up your magicspells.cfg in it you should get something looking like this rune1--rune1am--rune2---rune2am--rune under rune1-4 put -1 and under rune1am-4am put 0

Read full topic
